word: THE SEVENTH-DAY ADVENTIST CHURCH WAS BORN IN DIFFICULT AND EXCITING TIMES. MOST OF THOSE WHO PARTICIPATED IN ITS BEGINNINGS WERE YOUNG YET DEEPLY DEDICATED TO A STUDY OF THE WORD AND EAGER TO WITNESS FOR THEIR FAITH. IN THOSE FORMATIVE YEARS OF THE CHURCH OFTEN THERE WERE DEEPLY SPIRITUAL AND EMOTIONAL GATHERINGS OF ADVENTISTS. SOME OF THE EXPERIENCES THESE MEMBERS HAD GAVE EVIDENCE OF THE LEADING OF GOD'S SPIRIT, WHEREAS OTHERS WERE OBVIOUSLY OF ANOTHER SPIRIT.
